com.vernalis.knime.mmp

Class RDKitFragmentationUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.knime.mmp.RDKitFragmentationUtils

  • public class RDKitFragmentationUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class providing utility methods around the use of RDKit for fragmentation
    Author:
    s.roughley <knime@vernalis.com>

      As the bond priority order for SMILES (and RDKit objects is specifierd by CW / CCW order of bonds around the stereocentre, when a bond is broken and replaced with a new bond, in order to retain the true stereochemistry, it may be necessary to invert a stereocentre's CW/ CCW designation.

    • Method Detail

      • convertSmirksToReactionSmarts

        public static java.lang.String convertSmirksToReactionSmarts(java.lang.String SMIRKS)
        Function to convert the SMIRKS representation, with attachment points labelled by isotopic value (e.g. [2*]), to Reaction SMARTS, with attachment points labelled by atom label (e.g. ([*:2]). Unlabelled attachments are labelled '1'.
        Parameters:
        SMIRKS - The isotopically labelled reaction SMIRKS
        Returns:
        The Reaction SMARTS with correct attachment point labelling

      • validateReactionSmarts

        public static java.lang.String validateReactionSmarts(java.lang.String rSMARTS)
        Methods to validate reaction SMARTS
        • '>>' is required to separate reactants and products
        • Products require '[*]' to occur twice, for the attachment points (the node will handle the tagging of these)
        • Reactants and products require exactly two atom mappings, e.g. :1] and :2] (other values could be used).
        • The atom mappings must be two different values
        • The same atom mappings must be used for reactants and products
        Parameters:
        rSMARTS - The Reaction SMARTS to validate
        Returns:
        null if the SMARTS was validated, otherwise an error message informing of the first problem encountered

      • cutAllMatchingBonds

        public static java.lang.String cutAllMatchingBonds(org.RDKit.ROMol inMol,
                                   org.RDKit.ROMol bondMatch)

        Method to cut all bonds in inMol with match bondMatch

        The bond is removed, and the stub atoms are marked by setting their isotope to 500. If an atom is the stub atom more than once, then its isotope is set to 1000

        Parameters:
        inMol - The ROMol test molecule
        bondMatch - The ROMol query molecule to match a single bond
        Returns:
        A Single String for the multicomponent smiles of the bond-deleted molecule

      • markAllMatchingBonds

        public static java.lang.String markAllMatchingBonds(org.RDKit.ROMol inMol,
                                    org.RDKit.ROMol bondMatch)

        Method to mark all bonds in inMol with match bondMatch

        The atoms flanking the matching bonds are marked by setting their isotope to 500

        Parameters:
        inMol - The ROMol test molecule
        bondMatch - The ROMol query molecule to match a single bond
        Returns:
        A Single String for the smiles of the bond-marked molecule

      • identifyAllMatchingBonds

        public static java.util.Set<BondIdentifier> identifyAllMatchingBonds(org.RDKit.ROMol inMol,
                                                     org.RDKit.ROMol bondMatch)

        Method to identify (by start/end atom idxs wrapped as BondIdentifier) all bonds in a test molecule which match the bondMatch query

        NB some bonds might not be cuttable to give viable fragmentations

        Parameters:
        inMol - The ROMol test molecule
        bondMatch - The ROMol query molecule to match a single bond
        Returns:
        A Set of BondIdentifiers for matching bonds

      • identifyAllCuttableBonds

        public static java.util.Set<BondIdentifier> identifyAllCuttableBonds(org.RDKit.ROMol inMol,
                                                     org.RDKit.ROMol bondMatch,
                                                     int numCuts)
                                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Method to identify (by start/end atom idxs wrapped as BondIdentifier) all bonds in a test molecule which match the bondMatch query, and remove those from the list which may not be cut and still allow for the specified number of cuts to be made to give a valid Key/Value pair

        Parameters:
        inMol - The ROMol test molecule
        bondMatch - The ROMol query molecule to match a single bond
        numCuts - The number of bond breaks to be made (1- )
        Returns:
        A list of viable cutable bonds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numCuts is out of range 1-

      • canCutNTimes

                   org.RDKit.ROMol bondMatch,
                   int numCuts,
                   boolean allowBondValueForTwoCuts)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to test whether a way exists of cutting a given number of times using a specified bond cut type
        Parameters:
        inMol - The ROMol test molecule
        bondMatch - The ROMol query molecule to match a single bond
        numCuts - The number of bond breaks to be made (1- )
        Returns:
        true if the molecule can be cut
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numCuts is out of range 1-

      • maxNumCuts

        public static int maxNumCuts(org.RDKit.ROMol inMol,
             org.RDKit.ROMol bondMatch,
             boolean addHsFor1Cut,
             boolean allowBondValueForTwoCuts)

        Method to calculate the maximum number of cuts.

        The for 1 or 2 cuts the methods counts the number of matching bonds; for higher cuts, the molecule has all matching bonds broken using cutAllMatchingBonds(ROMol, ROMol), and the number of 'leaves' (i.e. fragments with only a single attachment point) are counted.

        In the event that no matching bonds are found, when H-adding for 1 cut is specified, hydrogens are added, and the matches counted again, resulting in 0 or 1 possible cuts.

        Parameters:
        inMol - The ROMol test molecule
        bondMatch - The ROMol query molecule to match a single bond
        addHsFor1Cut - true if Hydrogens are to be added if neede to test for 1 cut possibility
        Returns:
        The maximum number of cuts for the given schema

      • isValidCutTriplet

        public static boolean isValidCutTriplet(org.RDKit.RWMol mol,
                        BondIdentifier bond0,
                        BondIdentifier bond1,
                        BondIdentifier bond2)
        Failed cut triplets (i.e. 3 bonds which cut to R*.*R*.*R*.*R) are the cause of all higher order cut patterns which subsequently fail. This method cuts the molecule in all 3 places specified and checks that the above pattern is not returned
        Parameters:
        mol - The molecule
        bond0 - The first bond
        bond1 - The second bond
        bond2 - The third bond
        Returns:
        true if this gives 3 leaves and 1 core

      • isValidCutTriplet

        public static boolean isValidCutTriplet(org.RDKit.ROMol mol,
                        java.util.Collection<BondIdentifier> bonds)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Failed cut triplets (i.e. 3 bonds which cut to R*.*R*.*R*.*R) are the cause of all higher order cut patterns which subsequently fail. This method cuts the molecule in all 3 places specified and checks that the above pattern is not returned
        Parameters:
        mol - The molecule
        bonds - The set of bonds making up the 3-bond cut
        Returns:
        true if this gives 3 leaves and 1 core
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bonds specified is not 3

      • breakBond

        public static org.RDKit.RWMol breakBond(org.RDKit.RWMol mol,
                        BondIdentifier bond,
                        int index,
                        com.vernalis.knime.swiggc.SWIGObjectGarbageCollector swigGC,
                        int gcWrapLayer)
        Break a single bond identified by the start and end atom IDs of the supplied BondIdentifier. Dummy atoms are added with the indicated index as isotope. In other words, A-B becomes A-[n*].B-[n*] where n is the index.
        Parameters:
        mol - The input molecule
        bond - The bond to break
        index - The index of the attachment point dummy atoms. If index < 500, 500 is added
        swigGC - An instance of the SWIGObjectGarbageCollector to pass RDKit objects generated along the way to for later clean-up
        gcWrapLayer - The wrap layer index for the garbage collection object
        Returns:
        A multi-component molecule with a bond broken and dummy atoms added to each end of the broken bond

      • breakOneBondTwice

        public static org.RDKit.RWMol breakOneBondTwice(org.RDKit.RWMol mol,
                                BondIdentifier bond,
                                int index,
                                com.vernalis.knime.swiggc.SWIGObjectGarbageCollector swigGC,
                                int gcWrapLayer)
        Break a single bond identified by the start and end atom IDs of the supplied BondIdentifier, adding a sequential pair of IDs to the dummy atoms, and a pair of singly-bonded dummy atoms as a separate component with the same IDs. Dummy atoms are added with the indicated index as isotope. In other words, A-B becomes A-[n*].B-[(n+1)*].[n*]-[(n+1)*] where n is the index.
        Parameters:
        mol - The input molecule
        bond - The bond to break
        index - The index of the attachment point dummy atoms. If index < 500, 500 is added
        swigGC - An instance of the SWIGObjectGarbageCollector to pass RDKit objects generated along the way to for later clean-up
        gcWrapLayer - The wrap layer index for the garbage collection object
        Returns:
        A multi-component molecule with a bond broken and dummy atoms added to each end of the broken bond

      • fixBondChirality

        public static org.RDKit.RWMol fixBondChirality(org.RDKit.RWMol mol,
                               BondIdentifier bond,
                               com.vernalis.knime.swiggc.SWIGObjectGarbageCollector swigGC,
                               int gcWrapLayer)
        As the bond priority order for SMILES (and RDKit objects is specifierd by CW / CCW order of bonds around the stereocentre, when a bond is broken and replaced with a new bond, in order to retain the true stereochemistry, it may be necessary to invert a stereocentre's CW/ CCW designation. The RDKit ChemicalReaction class implements this directly by a slightly complex method. Here, we compose the old order of bond priorities, and look for the number of 'swaps' to get the new bond (which will be added at the end) back to the correct position. An odd number of swaps requires inversion. This method iterates through the atoms at either end of the bond. It does not fix double bond E/Z geometry
        Parameters:
        mol - The molecule to fix
        atomIdx - The atom ID of the atom to fix
        bondIdx - The bond ID of the bond to be replaced
        Returns:
        The molecule with the stereochemistry fixed

      • fixAtomChirality

        public static org.RDKit.RWMol fixAtomChirality(org.RDKit.RWMol mol,
                               long atomIdx,
                               long bondIdx,
                               com.vernalis.knime.swiggc.SWIGObjectGarbageCollector swigGC,
                               int gcWrapLayer)
        As the bond priority order for SMILES (and RDKit objects is specifierd by CW / CCW order of bonds around the stereocentre, when a bond is broken and replaced with a new bond, in order to retain the true stereochemistry, it may be necessary to invert a stereocentre's CW/ CCW designation. The RDKit ChemicalReaction class implements this directly by a slightly complex method. Here, we compose the old order of bond priorities, and look for the number of 'swaps' to get the new bond (which will be added at the end) back to the correct position. An odd number of swaps requires inversion
        Parameters:
        mol - The molecule to fix
        atomIdx - The atom ID of the atom to fix
        bondIdx - The bond ID of the bond to be replaced
        Returns:
        The molecule with the stereochemistry fixed

      • filterFragment

        public static boolean filterFragment(FragmentKey2 key,
                     FragmentValue2 value,
                     java.lang.Integer maxNumVarAtoms,
                     java.lang.Double minCnstToVarAtmRatio)
        Filter the fragment pair according to filters
        Parameters:
        key - The Key part of the fragmented molecule
        value - The Value part of the fragmented molecule
        maxNumVarAtoms - The maximum number of changing atoms (null if no filter)
        minCnstToVarAtmRatio - The minimum ration of constant to changing atoms (null if not filter)
        Returns:
        true if all specified filters are passed

      • removeHydrogens

        public static java.lang.String removeHydrogens(java.lang.String smiles)

        String parsing method to remove hydrogens from a SMILES String

        Chirality and double bond geometry is preserved, taking [H] inside the @] where required

        Parameters:
        smiles - The input SMILES String
        Returns:
        The SMILES String with Hydrogen atoms removed

      • getTransforms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.knime.core.data.DataCell[]> getTransforms(java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue2> fragmentValues,
                                                                int numNewCols,
                                                                boolean removeExplicitHs,
                                                                boolean includeNumChangingHAs,
                                                                boolean showReverseTransforms,
                                                                boolean allowSelfTransforms)
        Get the transfroms for a TreeSet of FragmentValue2s, optionally including the number of changing heavy atoms. This is the simple method not requiring access to the FragmentKey
        Parameters:
        fragmentValues - A TreeSet of FragmentValue2s from which to derive transforms
        numNewCols - The number of new columns - supplied so only calculated once during the NodeModel #configure method.
        removeExplicitHs - If true, then explicit hydrogens are removed from the outputs
        includeNumChangingHAs - If true, then the number of changing heavy atoms are added for each fragment
        showReverseTransforms - If true, then the output includes transformations in both directions
        allowSelfTransforms - If true, then transforms arising from two different cuts to a molecule giving the same key are allowed
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of DataCells for each new transform to be added derived from the TreeSet of FragmentValues
        See Also:
        #getTransforms(TreeSet, FragmentKey, int, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • getTransforms

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.knime.core.data.DataCell[]> getTransforms(java.util.TreeSet<FragmentValue2> fragmentValues,
                                                                FragmentKey2 fragmentKey,
                                                                int numNewCols,
                                                                boolean removeExplicitHs,
                                                                boolean includeKeySMILES,
                                                                boolean includeNumChangingHAs,
                                                                boolean includeRatioHAs,
                                                                boolean showReverseTransforms,
                                                                boolean allowSelfTransforms)
        Overloaded method to get the transforms for a TreeSet of FragmentValues, optionally including the number of changing heavy atoms, and properties relating to the FragmentKey2.
        Parameters:
        fragmentValues - A TreeSet of FragmentValue2s from which to derive transforms
        fragmentKey - The FragmentKey2 from which to derive the unchanging atoms and HA ratios
        numNewCols - The number of new columns - supplied so only calculated once during the NodeModel #configure method.
        removeExplicitHs - If true, then explicit hydrogens are removed from the outputs
        includeKeySMILES - If true, then the SMILES representation of the unchanging atoms is included in the output
        includeNumChangingHAs - If true, then the number of changing heavy atoms are added for each fragment
        includeRatioHAs - If true, then the rations of changing / unchanging heavy atoms are added for each transformation
        showReverseTransforms - If true, then the output includes transformations in both directions
        allowSelfTransforms - If true, then transforms arising from two different cuts to a molecule giving the same key are allowed
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of DataCells for each new transform to be added derived from the TreeSet of FragmentValues
        See Also:
        #getTransforms(TreeSet, int, boolean, boolean)
